title: Appendix A — Proposal
text:
An Analysis of the 2024 Mexican Presidential Election
By Isaiah Ramirez and Quinn Cowell

title: Appendix A — Proposal
text:
Proposal and reasoning
We will be analyzing and exploring the impact of the 2024 Mexican presidential election, in which the “appointed successor” of term-limited president Andrés Manuel López Obrador, Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo, was elected in a landslide victory. We will be breaking down the results by state, reviewing various variables that may have attributed to Sheinbaum Pardo’s overwhelming victory. We chose this topic because we wanted to learn more details about the recent Mexican federal elections, which were significant for the political trajectory of Mexico, and likely by extension the United States, but were not widely discussed in the media at the time.


Implementation and reponsibility plan

title: Appendix B — Case Study
text:
We chose this FiveThirtyEight article about the 2017 Bundestag elections in Germany.
Isaiah’s Observations

6 visuals in total
Title
Presenting questions before actual explanations
Gives a table that gives reader general idea of variables
List sources in bottom right corner of viz
In the end they also acknowledge needing to consider other variables as well that they may not have gotten to look at

Quinn’s Observations

Comparisons with American political parties to situate -> important to define audience
Variety of data visualizations: maps, tables, charts, graphs
Colorful!!
Overview of all political parties and explanations of voting patterns (about Bundestag elections)
History!! Discussion of East vs. West Germany, previous incarnations of political parties
Visualizations supplement the text, not the other way around
